analysis: The documents consist of executive orders that authorize the inspection of tax returns by various congressional committees and government entities. The reasons for inspection vary, including investigations into national defense programs, un-American activities, juvenile delinquency, government operations, commodity credit corporation, federal-aid highway program, relations with Indian tribes, financial interests of Senate officers and employees, welfare and pension funds, impeachment proceedings, receivership and bankruptcy proceedings, election of members of Congress, economic stabilization, and naval affairs. The orders cite the authority vested in the President by the Internal Revenue Code.
title: Authorizing Congressional Access to Tax Information
